2:T899,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"Do Filipinos need a visa for Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, Filipino citizens need a tourist visa before travel. Apply at the Argentine embassy in Manila. The visa allows 90 days stay. For longer stays, apply for residency after arrival."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is there a Filipino community?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, small but growing - 5,000-8,000 Filipinos in Argentina, mainly in Buenos Aires. Concentrated in healthcare, domestic work, and services. Active Facebook groups provide community support."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What jobs do Filipinos do?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Many work as nurses, caregivers, domestic helpers, and in services. English-speaking Filipinos are in high demand for childcare and eldercare. Some work in hospitality and offices."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is English enough to get by?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"English helps for some jobs (caregiving, childcare), but Spanish is essential for daily life and residency processes. Most Filipinos learn Spanish within 6-12 months of arrival."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I send money home?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, many Filipinos send remittances. Wise, Remitly, and Western Union popular. Some maintain Philippine bank accounts and transfer regularly."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I bring my family?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, once you obtain residency, you can apply for family reunification for spouse and children. Process takes several months."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Will I lose my Philippine citizenship?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No, Philippines allows dual citizenship. You can become Argentine while keeping your Philippine passport. Many Filipinos maintain both."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Is Filipino food available?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Limited but available. Some Asian supermarkets in Belgrano carry Filipino ingredients. Filipino restaurants exist but are few. Most Filipinos cook at home."}}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"{\"@context\":\"https://schema.org\",\"@type\":\"BreadcrumbList\",\"itemListElement\":[{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":1,\"name\":\"Home\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":2,\"name\":\"Nationalities\",\"item\":\"https://expatsargentina.com/nationality\"},{\"@type\":\"ListItem\",\"position\":3,\"name\":\"Philippines\"}]}"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen","children":[["$","section",null,{"className":"bg-gradient-to-b from-primary/10 to-background py-12 md:py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container px-4 md:px-6","children":[["$","nav",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-2 text-sm text-muted-foreground mb-6","children":[["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/","className":"hover:text-foreground transition-colors","children":"Home"}],["$","span",null,{"children":"/"}],["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/nationality","className":"hover:text-foreground transition-colors","children":"Nationalities"}],["$","span",null,{"children":"/"}],["$","span",null,{"className":"text-foreground","children":"Philippines"}]]}],"$L4"]}]}],"$L5","$L6"]}]],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
